basic_functionality.description: Core game mechanics are implemented and functional

features_tested.description: Player class with physics-based movement, gravity, and collision detection
LevelGenerator creates procedurally generated levels with increasing difficulty
Side-scrolling camera that follows the player
Goomba-style enemies with patrol behavior and collision detection
Score tracking with coin collection, enemy defeat, and flag bonus
High score saved to JSON file

observations: Well-structured code with clear class separation (Player, Enemy, Coin, LevelGenerator, Game, Camera)
Proper use of dataclasses and enums
Type hints used throughout the codebase
Procedural level generation with increasing difficulty
Clean separation of concerns (input handling, update logic, rendering)

recommendations: Consider adding sound effects for better gameplay experience
Could benefit from additional visual feedback for player actions
conclusion: The Vector Super Mario Bros Multi-Level Platformer is a fully functional side-scrolling platformer game. All core features are implemented including procedural level generation, physics-based movement, enemy AI, collectible system, and multi-level progression. The code is well-structured and follows good programming practices.
